intro: Brossaea bandongensis, commonly known as the Bandongensis Brossaea, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often found in montane forests. Its leaves are ovate with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
